main_definition: Copies refer to the act of making identical or similar versions of a document, image, object, etc., or it can also mean multiple instances or replicas of something.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To reproduce or duplicate an original item such as a written document, photo, or artwork.
meanings_and_examples.example: The secretary made copies of the meeting minutes for all attendees.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Multiple instances of something that are similar but not necessarily exact replicas.
meanings_and_examples.example: They had three different models, or copies, of a car available to choose from.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make an identical version of digital content like files or documents for backup or distribution purposes.
meanings_and_examples.example: Before sending the email, he made multiple copies as backups in case one got lost during transmission.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In computing and technology, referring to the act of duplicating data across storage devices.
meanings_and_examples.example: The server performed a backup by creating hard disk copies of all files.
